thread.title: Joining Madonna and the Beatles, Rihanna lands 30th top-10 hit, sets sights on record
thread.title_full: Joining Madonna and the Beatles, Rihanna lands 30th top-10 hit, sets sights on record

author: Randall Roberts
title: Joining Madonna and the Beatles, Rihanna lands 30th top-10 hit, sets sights on record
text:
Joining Madonna and the Beatles, Rihanna lands 30th top-10 hit, sets sights on record Rihanna Rihanna has achieved a hit-making milestone. Rihanna has achieved a hit-making milestone. (Christopher Polk / Getty Images) Randall Roberts .
She charted her 30th hit this week when “Love on the Brain” crossed the threshold to land at No. 8. It’s the fourth top-10 track from Rihanna’s most recent album, “Anti,” and its success breaks her tie with Michael Jackson, who earned 29 top-10 hits. SNAP Video Rihanna, "Love on the Brain" video Rihanna, "Love on the Brain" video See more videos 
On the incendiary “Love on the Brain,” which was co-written and produced by Fred Ball, Rihanna sings of “fist-fighting with fire,” a strategy she’s used in service of her career. Beyoncé may earn the critical kudos, but since Rihanna first hit in 2005 with “Pon de Replay,” the Barbadian has been pop music’s most reliable heat-seeker. 
In fact, Rihanna has more hits than she has years on the planet. She earned her 30th smash a few days after her 29th birthday. At this rate, she’ll surpass the Beatles’ 34 hits by 2020 and Madonna’s record 38 top-10 songs by 2025. Caption Kenneth Turan and Justin Chang talk about the Oscars
